page.title: 14GRAFFITI
page.content: The Co-op has been praised for painting over the graffiti on the front of it's Faifley shops. Now just a fortnight later the vandals have been at work again and though not serious graffiti has started to appear again. In January District Councillor Betty Brown had hit out at the state of the shop frontage.She claimed that other shops in the area had managed to keep their buildings clean and only the Co-op had not. Last month the Faifley councillor told the Environmental Committee meeting that she was pleased to see the Co-op had been repainted. Now the graffiti seems to be creep- ing back again leaving the management with another costly painting bill looming in the near future.
